data.title: Quick picks: New movies, Royals hockey, Berks Youth Chorus, Lancaster Roots and Blues music festival
data.meta_description: MOVIES“Foxcatcher” A great Olympic wrestling champion brother team joins Team Foxcatcher, led by multimillionaire John E. du Pont, to train for the 1988 games in Seoul, South Korea. It’s a union that leads to deadly circumstances. Starring Channing Tatum and Oscar nominees Steve Carell and Mark Ruffalo. Rated R for some drug use and a […]
data.text:
For information on submitting an obituary, please contact Reading Eagle by phone at 610-371-5018, or email at obituaries@readingeagle.com or fax at 610-371-5193.

Most obituaries published in the Reading Eagle are submitted through funeral homes and cremation services, but we will accept submissions from families. Obituaries can be emailed to obituaries@readingeagle.com.

In addition to the text of the obituary, any photographs that you wish to include can be attached to this email. Please put the text of the obituary in a Word document, a Google document or in the body of the email. The Reading Eagle also requires a way to verify the death, so please include either the phone number of the funeral home or cremation service that is in charge of the deceased's care or a photo of his/her death certificate. We also request that your full name, phone number and address are all included in this email.

All payments by families must be made with a credit card. We will send a proof of the completed obituary before we require payment. The obituary cannot run, however, until we receive payment in full.

Obituaries can be submitted for any future date, but they must be received no later than 3:00 p.m. the day prior to its running for it to be published.

Please call the obituary desk, at 610-371-5018, for information on pricing.

MOVIES

“Foxcatcher” A great Olympic wrestling champion brother team joins Team Foxcatcher, led by multimillionaire John E. du Pont, to train for the 1988 games in Seoul, South Korea. It’s a union that leads to deadly circumstances. Starring Channing Tatum and Oscar nominees Steve Carell and Mark Ruffalo. Rated R for some drug use and a scene of violence. Starts Friday at the GoggleWorks Film Theatre.

“Jupiter Ascending” In a bright and colorful future, a young, destitute caretaker gets targeted by a ruthless son of a powerful family that lives on a planet in need of a new heir, so she travels with a genetically engineered warrior to the planet in order to stop his tyrannical reign. With Mila Kunis, Channing Tatum and Eddie Redmayne. Rated PG-13 for some violence, sequences of sci-fi action, some suggestive content and partial nudity. Starts Friday at Carmike 10 at Fairgrounds Square, Fox Berkshire, R/C Reading Movies 11 and Imax.

“Seventh Son” Young Thomas is apprecticed to the local Spook to learn to fight evil spirits. His first great challenge comes when the powerful Mother Malkin escapes her confinement when the Spook is away. With Ben Barnes, Julianne Moore and Jeff Bridges. Rated PG-13 for intense fantasy violence and action throughout, frightening images and brief strong language. Starts Friday Carmike 10 at Fairgrounds Square, Fox East, R/C Reading Movies 11 and Imax.

“The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge Out of Water” SpongeBob goes on a quest to discover a stolen recipe that takes him to another dimension, our world, where he tangles with a pirate. With Antonio Banderas, Frankie Muniz and the voices of Clancy Brown and Tom Kenny. Rated PG for mild action and some rude humor. Begins Friday at Carmike 10 at Fairgrounds Square, Fox Berkshire, Fox East, R/C Reading Movies 11 and Imax. More on Pages 11-12.

SPORTS

Royals hockey The Reading Royals host the Florida Everblades for three ECHL games: Friday at 7:30 p.m., Saturday at 7:05 p.m. and Sunday at 5:05 p.m. Friday is Ladies Night with a special appearance by soap-opera star Tyler Christopher of “General Hospital.” Saturday is Metro Bank Beach Towel Night, with a beach-towel giveaway to the first 2,000 fans ages 15 and older. It is also Penn State University THON Night. with a postgame auction benefiting the charity. And Sunday is Disney/Pixar Night, with special appearances from Disney and Pixar characters. Tickets range from $11 to $28. Phone: 610-898-7469. Website: www.royalshockey.com.

CONCERT

Berks Youth Chorus The BYC will hold its second pops concert, “Up and Down the Radio Dial,” at 4 p.m. Sunday at Schaeffer Auditorium on the campus of Kutztown University, Kutztown. Music features the best from late-night radio jazz sessions to early-morning Broadway broadcasts. The chorus is pulling out all the stops with choreographed performances by more than 100 singers in four ensembles: Training Chorus, Choristers, Chorale and MasterSingers. Tickets are $25 for VIP seats, $15 for adults and $10 for students. Tickets may be purchased in advance by calling 610-898-7664 or at the door. Website: www.berksyouthchorus.org.

MUSIC

Lancaster festival Lancaster Roots and Blues, a Festival of Music, runs from Friday through Saturday at various venues in Lancaster, featuring musicians from across the United States and around the world. With 10 stages and huge variety of musicians – more than 50 in all at eight venues – this annual festival offers a broad range of music. All the venues are within walking distance of one another. Buses will be available to transport visitors from one venue to another as well. For a map of venues, a complete lineup of performers and the various ticket options, visit the website at lancasterrootsandblues.com. Phone: 717-391-9722.

Originally Published: February 5, 2015 at 12:00 a.m.
